name: Brahma Temple
excerpt: Pushkar’s most famous temple is the Brahma Temple, said to be one of the few such temples in the world as a result of a curse by Brahma’s consort,…
detail_description: Pushkar’s most famous temple is the Brahma Temple, said to be one of the few such temples in the world as a result of a curse by Brahma’s consort, Saraswati. The temple is marked by a red spire, and over the entrance gateway is the hans (goose symbol) of Brahma. Inside, the floor and walls are engraved with dedications to the dead.

name: Varah Ghat
excerpt: Vishnu appeared at Varah Ghat in the form of a boar.
detail_description: Vishnu appeared at Varah Ghat in the form of a boar.

name: Brahma Ghat
excerpt: A bathing ghat dedicated to Brahma and below the Brahma temple.
detail_description: A bathing ghat dedicated to Brahma and below the Brahma temple.

name: Jain Temple
excerpt: This intricately carved Jain temple is found on the western shore of Pushkar Lake.
detail_description: This intricately carved Jain temple is found on the western shore of Pushkar Lake.

name: Gurdwara
excerpt: The ornate, multidomed gurdwara hosts Pushkar's Sikh community and welcomes visitors.
detail_description: The ornate, multidomed gurdwara hosts Pushkar's Sikh community and welcomes visitors.

name: Naya Rangji Temple
excerpt: The large Naya (new) Rangji temple is east of the lake and is the scene of regular chanting devotions.
detail_description: The large Naya (new) Rangji temple is east of the lake and is the scene of regular chanting devotions.

name: Gandhi Ghat
excerpt: Gandhi’s ashes were sprinkled here on Gau Ghat and since then it has also been known as Gandhi Ghat.
detail_description: Gandhi’s ashes were sprinkled here on Gau Ghat and since then it has also been known as Gandhi Ghat.

name: Old Rangji Temple
excerpt: Old Rangji Temple (c 1844) is close to the bazaar and is alternatively empty and peaceful or alive with chanting worshippers.
detail_description: Old Rangji Temple (c 1844) is close to the bazaar and is alternatively empty and peaceful or alive with chanting worshippers.

name: Pap Mochani (Gayatri) Temple
excerpt: The sunrise views over town from Pap Mochani (Gayatri) Temple, reached by a track behind the Marwar bus stand, are well worth the 30-minute climb.
detail_description: The sunrise views over town from Pap Mochani (Gayatri) Temple, reached by a track behind the Marwar bus stand, are well worth the 30-minute climb.

name: Shiva Temples
excerpt: About 8km southwest of town (past the turn-off to Savitri Mata Temple) is a collection of Shiva temples near Ajaypal, which make a great trip by motorbike…
detail_description: About 8km southwest of town (past the turn-off to Savitri Mata Temple) is a collection of Shiva temples near Ajaypal, which make a great trip by motorbike (or bike if you’re fit and start early in the day), through barren hills and quiet villages. Be warned: the track is hilly and rocky.

name: Savitri Mata Temple
excerpt: The ropeway (9.30am to 7.30pm, return trip ₹119) makes the ascent to the hilltop Saraswati Temple a breeze. The temple overlooks the lake and the views…
detail_description: The ropeway (9.30am to 7.30pm, return trip ₹119) makes the ascent to the hilltop Saraswati Temple a breeze. The temple overlooks the lake and the views are fantastic at any time of day. Alternatively, you could take the one-hour trek up before dawn to beat the heat and capture the best light.
